page.title: 09FARMING,SEWAGE AND GOLF
page.content: This unlikely coincidence is found in one of the blocks along with a number of shops and houses and one school. In 1985 the farm buildings of Manor Farm ,built 99 years ago were demolished and new houses are now being built on the site. The West Leicester golf course is used widely and overlaps onto part of this area. There is still some farmland for grazing and the sewage works,which are well away from the residential part of the land,is quite modern.These works serve most of West Leicester. Until the war,Glenfield village was seperate from Leicester but is now linked to the city by the spread of New Parks Council Estate.
